alert.note: Alert for Burlington; Camden; Gloucester (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 25 at 5:58PM EDT until June 25 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CAMDEN...EAST CENTRAL GLOUCESTER AND WEST CENTRAL BURLINGTON COUNTIES... At 557 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Chesilhurst, or 17 miles southeast of Gloucester City, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Evesham, Voorhees, Lindenwold, Berlin, Tabernacle, Chesilhurst, Atco, Sicklerville, Williamstown, Marlton Lakes, Monroe Township, Marlton, Springdale, Greentree, Pine Hill, Clementon, Medford Lakes, Gibbsboro and Pine Valley. This includes Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 30 and 42. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
